item.title: Best Sci-Fi games By Capcom, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Capcom's diverse legacy includes polygonal fighters like Star Gladiator, offering unique gameplay experiences beyond their classic franchises.
  • Battle Circuit, Capcom's final arcade title, allows four players to control bounty hunters with upgradable abilities, now available in a bundle.
  • Remember Me showcases Capcom's narrative prowess through a psycho-narrative adventure with memory-themed powers and engaging storytelling.

Capcom has been a major developer of video games for the better part of 40 years. In that time they have not only created many of the staple video game franchises gamers have come to love but extended their reach into almost every genre and style of title possible.

Even within the science fiction genre, Capcom's legacy is as varied as other aspects of the company's ventures. This extends from chibi-esque action platformers to extravagant war simulations requiring hundreds of dollars worth of investment.

10 Star Gladiator - Episode I: The Final Crusade

A 3D Breakthrough In Capcom's Fighting Game Legacy

  • Platform(s): Arcade, PlayStation
  • Developer(s): Capcom
  • Genre(s): Fighting
  • Released: July, 1996

Capcom is arguably the fighting game video game publisher; developing genre classics like Street Fighter, and crossover behemoths such as Marvel vs. Capcom. However, while these franchises were making the most out of pixel-perfect graphics, in 1996 Capcom's first in-house polygonal fighter, Star Gladiator , was released.

More similar to weapon fighters like Soul Calibur , this 3D sci-fi fighter was originally a Star Wars tie-in. What resulted was a solid, unique fighter with characters such as a monkey-like alien and an assassin robot entering the fray.

9 Battle Circuit

Capcom's Sci-Fi Beat 'Em Up Swansong

  • Platform(s): Arcade
  • Developer(s): Capcom
  • Genre(s): Beat 'em up
  • Released: March 19, 1997

While the arcades had been the breeding ground for some of Capcom's best-known franchises, in 1997 the company sought to release its last arcade title.

Following a group of bounty hunters in an alternate future, Battle Circuit includes upgradable abilities and unique playstyles between its four available characters who can be played simultaneously by four individual players. Thankfully, though it was developed as a Capcom arcade swansong, it is now available as part of the Capcom Beat Em Up Bundle released in 2018.

8 Section Z

An Adored NES Adaptation of Capcom's Arcade Shoot 'Em Up

  • Platform(s): Arcade, Nintendo Entertainment System
  • Developer(s): Capcom
  • Genre(s): Shoot 'em up
  • Released: July 01, 1987

Section Z may seem like another shoot 'em up on platforms that did not lack the genre. However, set in the third millennium, instead of controlling a separate ship you control the pilot himself.

As such, you have control of both the X and Y axes of movement as you attempt to destroy the Alien -esque space station housing the deadly Bangalool nest. While the game was released in arcades, the NES port is seen by gamers as one of the best titles on the system.

7 Steel Battalion

A Mechanized Marvel With Pricey Peripherals

If there is one thing gamers know about Steel Battalion , it's most likely the expansive required joystick controller setup. Placing players in the role of a bipedal mech pilot, the title is more of an action simulation than a typical action adventure. That's not to say that the explosive action on display is anything to smirk at.

However if players don't eject their mechs, having received a deadly amount of damage, they should be prepared to explode and have their save data overwritten.

6 Mega Man Legends 2

A Much-Loved Sequel Of A Capcom Legend

Capcom's Mega Man series is one of its most prolific. As such, it's no surprise the franchise has spawned more than its fair share of subseries, across genres.

Many gamers' favorite of these is the third-person 3D action-platformer Mega Man Legends series. The original 1997 spin-off saw the inclusion of RPG elements and a sandbox style of gameplay. However, its 2000 sequel is seen by gamers as the subseries' best. While the core gameplay had little changed, the graphical design and style were heavily praised.

5 Lost Planet: Extreme Condition

An Action-Packed Adventure On A Frozen Landscape

Tasking players with braving the sub-zero temperatures of E.D.N III, 2007's Lost Planet is the opening title from Capcom's third-person shooter franchise. While patrolling the frozen landscape of the new planet after a postapocalyptic disaster, players can also switch to a first-person perspective or even control the game's gargantuan mechs, called Vital Suits.

While the alien-killing action and gameplay of the series would become tighter with each entry, the desolate sci-fi narrative of the original is seen by gamers as the strongest of the trilogy.

4 Strider

A Fluid Action-Platformer With A Long-Lasting Legacy

  • Platform(s): Arcade, Sega Genesis
  • Developer(s): Capcom
  • Genre(s): Action-platformer
  • Released: January, 1989

Despite not being as well-known as Street Fighter or Mega Ma n, Strider is a title many gamers hold dear. Released in 1989, this 2D action platformer set itself apart by distancing from stoic platformer controls.

What players experience is an acrobatic adventure taking down near-future Russian antagonists with a selection of ranged and melee weaponry. Beautifully rendered pixel art depicts aesthetically contrasting stages and enemies in a title that is as fluid as Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown - 40 years before that title's release.

3 Bionic Commando Rearmed

A Revitalised Remake With No Strongarmed Gimmicks

  • Platform(s): PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, PC
  • Developer(s): Capcom
  • Genre(s): Action, Platformer
  • Released: August 14, 2008

Bionic Commando is a series with a very chequered past as one of Capcom's former flagship series. However, before the mediocre reception of its 2009 reboot, Capcom celebrated the series' 20th anniversary with a 2.5D pseudo-remake of the 1988 classic.

Players control the eponymous Bionic Commando, an action-hero protagonist with a robotic arm that can be extended and used as a weapon. This action-platforming reimagining sees gamers tackle Axis-esque uniformed antagonists and is one of the platform's best-received Xbox Live Arcade titles.

2 Remember Me

A Psychological Narrative With Mind-Bending Abilities

Capcom has developed some of the most intuitive gameplay systems in gaming. Beyond that, they are arguably the bastions of the survival horror genre through their Resident Evil franchise. However, in 2013 they looked to bolster their narrative prowess through the release of Remember Me.

A psycho-narrative third-person action adventure, Remember Me was designed specifically to provide an engaging narrative. Its much-loved female protagonist Nilin may suffer from amnesia but uses memory-themed powers to tackle enemies - stealing memories to gain abilities and scrambling antagonists' minds.

1 Mega Man 2

The Quintessential Adventure Of The Blue Bomber

With such an expansive franchise as Capcom's Mega Man series, it's nigh-impossible to attempt to whittle it down to its very best title. However, one installment that shone brightest for most fans is 1988's Mega Man 2.

A direct sequel to the original, it took everything that made the original platforming classic great and expanded upon it. What resulted is one of the greatest video games of all time, with Takashi Tateishi's NES score still being considered one of the medium's best.

item.title: Fallout London: Crystalline Photon Agitator Location
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Buying a Crystalline Photon Agitator
  • Finding a Crystalline Photon Agitator (Recommended)

Early on in your Fallout London journey, you're likely to find yourself helping out the Vagabonds. What begins as a short and simple quest to repair a radio quickly turns into a multi-stage adventure of tracking down important items for various members of the group. The final step in this quest requires you to track down a Crystalline Photon Agitator.

Bullettooth Anthony, a member of the Vagabond Faction in Fallout London , won't allow you to use his workbench while he's reassembling a laser weapon on it. He's missing a crucial component, however, so you'll need to track it down if you want to speed him along and repair Nelson's radio. This missing component is a Crystalline Photon Agitator, which he suggests purchasing off a trader somewhere. While you certainly can do this, and a previous step in the quest sent you to a merchant who sells one, you can find one for free by traveling a short distance south of the Swan and Mitre.

Buying a Crystalline Photon Agitator

Luckily, this particular item is fairly easy to purchase from traders. The trader you visited slightly earlier in this same questline, Nadia, usually has one in stock. Alternatively, you could try your luck at any of the game's other traders, such as the ones found in Thameshaven and many other settlements throughout London. Thameshaven is likely your best bet early on if you're determined to avoid visiting Nadia again for whatever reason, though you'll need to help Thameshaven with its pest problem before you can shop there.

Finding a Crystalline Photon Agitator (Recommended)

It's luckily pretty easy to find a Crystalline Photon Agitator in the game world. You'll want to head south from the Swan and Mitre until you reach Bromley. At the location shown on the map above, you'll find a long-abandoned shop called Wolfy's, with the item you need lying on a desk inside. The lamp is pointed at it as if to deliberately draw your attention to it. Grab it and head back to "Bullettooth" Anthony to hand it over and continue the quest.

item.title: Mortal Kombat 1: Every DLC Fighter In Year One, Ranked
item.description:
With the release of Takeda Takahashi, Mortal Kombat 1 has finished its first year of DLC characters. It featured a healthy mix of original Mortal Kombat fighters as well as guest characters, with some standing out more than others.

When it comes to DLC in Mortal Kombat 1 , there are multiple things to consider in terms of quality. Not only is their gameplay important, but so is their presentation: their designs, their alternate skins, voice-acting, and even their gruesome fatalities play a part in shaping how good the fighters are at play.

6 Homelander

Milking Out Evil Superheroes

  • 1st Fatality : Down, Forward, Down, 3 (Mid-Distance)
  • 2nd Fatality : Back, Forward, Back, 2 (Anywhere)
  • First Appearance : The Boys (Comic)

On the one hand, the replication of Antony Starr's villainous Homelander in The Boys is astonishing. On the other hand, Homelander's gameplay proves that he was better in concept rather than execution. Players felt that Homelander's focus on flying was far from intuitive and lacked the flow that most characters feature.

After Omni-Man's release, Homelander's abilities and visuals didn't do enough to stand out other than eye lasers, similar to Superman and Supergirl from Netherrealm Studios' Injustice 2 . Even the writing seemed more like a caricature of Homelander, who was more concerned about memes than portraying the character.

5 Ermac

They Are Many And Very Dangerous

  • 1st Fatality : Down, Forward, Down, 4 (Mid-Distance)
  • 2nd Fatality : Back, Forward, Back, 2 (Mid-Distance)
  • First Appearance : Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3

Finally, playable again for the first time since Mortal Kombat X, and with a lot of strange lore to the franchise, Ermac was what fans expected from the character. Spectral telekinetic powers combined with middle to far-range attacks allow them to control the venue and keep their opponent on their toes.

In many games, Ermac has been a nightmare for the online and local multiplayer, which has not changed with Mortal Kombat 1 . Ermac can attack the player from any range and any side, forcing the other player to need to keep the pressure on them. As a nice bonus, this new take on Ermac depicts them more as a ghostly figure to help them stand out from his portrayal in past timelines.

4 Quan Chi

Necromancy & Eldritch Horrors Galore

  • 1st Fatality : Forward, Back, Forward, Back, 2 (Mid-Distance)
  • 2nd Fatality : Down, Forward, Back, 4 (Mid-Distance)
  • First Appearance : Mortal Kombat: Defenders Of The Realm (Show)

As expected, Quan Chi in Mortal Kombat 1 can summon skeletal constructs to fight his opponents; this time in both his special moves and his combos. However, much to the surprise of fans, this version of Quan Chi was given more abilities, including summoning crustaceans and cephalopod-like monsters straight out of Lovecraftian lore via his portals.

The best way to describe Quan Chi in Mortal Kombat 1 is if someone fused Doctor Strange from the Marvel universe with the Hell Priest cenobite from Hellraiser . He's cruel and wicked with all of his banter with other characters and all his finishers are some of the most brutal to find in the game.

3 Peacemaker

Nothing Like A Bloodbath To Start The Day

  • 1st Fatality : Down, Forward, Down, 4 (Mid-Distance)
  • 2nd Fatality : Back, Forward, Back, 2 (Mid-Distance)
  • First Appearance : Fightin' 5 #40 (Comic)

Not only does John Cena reprise his role as Peacemaker since he is a nearly perfect live-action version of the character, but Netherrealm Studios went all out in injecting dozens of references from the antihero series and James Gunn's The Suicide Squad . Combined with special moves that include summoning Eagly, helmet abilities, and a plethora of weapons, Peacemaker is versatile.

Peacemaker looks like someone who controls like a brute moving through molasses, but Peacemaker proved to be so effective that the developers chose to nerf him due to complaints. Even in his weaker state, Peacemaker continues to be a powerful fighter in the online community.

2 Omni-Man

Violent Viltrumite In All Realms

  • 1st Fatality : Down, Down, Back, 4 (Close Distance)
  • 2nd Fatality : Down, Forward, Back, 3 (Mid-Distance)
  • First Appearance : Invincible #1 (Comic)

Every Mortal Kombat game has at least one fighter that online players dread coming across, and Omni-Man is one of them for Mortal Kombat 1 . From the Invincible animated series and comics, Omni-Man's greatest trait is his super speed, allowing him to close the gap on his opponents almost instantly and deal devastating damage.

Having J.K. Simmons return as the character to interact with the likes of Johnny Cage and Mileena is a nice perk, but so are his brutal moves inspired by famous kills in the show. Grinding through mastery levels allows players to unlock various new capes, gauntlets, and colors for Omni-Man, including a palette inspired by his son Invincible, making among the finest cosmetics of the DLC.

1 Takeda

Return Of The Kombat Kid

  • 1st Fatality : Down, Forward, Down, 3 (Mid-Distance)
  • 2nd Fatality : Back, Forward, Back, 2 (Anywhere)
  • First Appearance : Mortal Kombat X

Where Cassie Cage and Jacqui Briggs got to shine as great fighters in Mortal Kombat 11 , Takeda Takahashi is the only Kombat Kid to return to the New Era, even with a different origin and relation to Kenshi Takahashi. However, Takeda is still ninja-like, wielding his signature bladed whips that result in bloody fatalities that even longtime Mortal Kombat fans cringe at.

Takeda is a lot like Ermac where he can attack from nearly any range, but what makes him deadlier is that he can launch his opponents into the air with ease. This extends the combo for him to keep attacking or knocking them down, which also makes him effective against other aerial-based enemies such as Sindel or Homelander.

item.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Will Release Sooner Than Expected
item.description:
Highlights

  • Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP release date adjusted to September 12, 2024.
  • Players can choose from four different voice actors for Juliet Starling, including Tara Strong and Yukari Tamura.
  • Remaster includes 30 costumes for Juliet Starling and 480 customization options for unique gameplay experience.

Dragami Games has announced that Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP will be released two weeks earlier than initially planned, but only for American and European audiences. The remake of the Grasshopper Manufacture title, Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP , which was first announced in July 2022 with a 2023 release window to celebrate the original game's tenth anniversary, had faced delays.

In recent months, the developers of Lollipop Chainsaw have been actively sharing detailed updates about the upcoming remaster. One of the significant changes includes the option for players to choose from four different voice actors for the protagonist, Juliet Starling. Juliet will now be voiced by Yukari Tamura in addition to Tara Strong, the original English voice actor, and Japanese voice actresses Eri Kitamura and Yoko Hikasa. Additionally, Yoshimi Yasuda has confirmed that the remaster will incorporate a variety of quality-of-life improvements and enhancements aimed at refining the gameplay experience. Alongside these updates, it has been confirmed that the remaster will be released across several platforms, including Steam, PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and Nintendo Switch.

On June 14, the release date for the Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP was initially set for September 25, 2024. This information was conveyed through a game trailer and an official social media announcement made by Yoshimi Yasuda. Recently, Yoshimi Yasuda provided an update via his Twitter account, revealing a change in the release schedule. The updated release date for the digital version of Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP in North, Central, and South America, as well as Europe, is now September 12, 2024. Additionally, the retail price has been confirmed as $44.99.

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP: Release Dates for America and Europe

  • September 12, 2024

This adjustment means players in these regions will have the opportunity to access the game two weeks earlier than initially planned, a change likely to be welcomed by fans eager to experience it sooner. While it remains to be seen how the remastered version will be received, fans of the cult classic Lollipop Chainsaw can pre-order a remastered collector’s edition for $150. This Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Cheerleader Edition includes a 10-inch Juliet Starling statue, a Nick head keychain, an artbook, and other exclusive items, all packaged in a locker-themed box.

Another interesting revelation is that Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP will feature a total of 30 different costumes for Juliet Starling. These include both the original designs from the game and new costumes created specifically for the remaster. Players will have access to a remarkable 480 different customization options, allowing for a wide array of looks and styles for Juliet.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for August 6, 2024
item.description:
Strands has yet another grid filled with hidden words for today, August 6, 2024. If you are struggling to get through this one, you are almost certainly not alone. This Strands is not the most challenging puzzle that the NTY has come up with yet, but it's far from the easiest too.

If you already know how to play Strands and need help with today's puzzle, check out the sections below. In them, there are general hints about the theme of the August 6 puzzle, some spoilers, and more. Everything you need to solve this one can be found in this article.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #156 August 6, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue Bed, Bath, and Beyond . There are six items to find: one Spangram and five themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

Since the in-game hint system does spoil whole words, this article has three general hints about the theme that won't spoil any words from the answer. If you want to see them, press the Read More button below each to open up the expandable sections for this relaxing puzzle game.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Each of the two boxes below has one spoiled word and a screenshot of where it goes in the letter grid. You can check inside one or both to get a better idea of what the theme of today's puzzle is.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

In the expandable section below, you will find the complete spoiler to today's Strands. Only click the Read More button if you want to see all the themed words and a screenshot of this PC puzzle game that has been completed.

Today's Strands Explained

The clue, the Spangram, and the themed words not make sense to you? If you want to know how these all go together, check out the section below. It will explain everything you need to know about this browser-based puzzle game.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.
